xxl.core.pipes.operators.sorters
Class PredicateSorter<I>

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.pipes.queryGraph.AbstractNode
      xxl.core.pipes.operators.AbstractPipe<I,I>
          xxl.core.pipes.operators.sorters.PredicateSorter<I>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Pipe<I,I>, Node, Sink<I>, Source<I>, MetaDataManageable<Object,Object>, MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>
public class PredicateSorter<I>
extends AbstractPipe<I,I>

Operator component in a query graph that sorts a buffer (queue) each time the user-defined predicate overflows is fulfilled.
The sorting is performed in a user-defined unary function, so that this class abstracts from the sorting algorithm that is used, e.g. quick-sort, merge-sort or heap-sort can be realized.

Example usage (1): 

        PredicateSorter sorter = new PredicateSorter(
                new RandomNumber(RandomNumber.DISCRETE, 10000, 0),
                new ListQueue(new ArrayList(100)),
                new Predicate() {
                        // buffer is sorted and flushed every 100 elements
                        public boolean invoke(Object buffer, Object o) { 
                                return ((Queue)buffer).size() < 100 ? false : true;
                        }
                },
                new Function() {
                        public Object invoke(Object buffer) {
                                Queue queue = (Queue)buffer;
                                Object[] objects = new Object[queue.size()];
                                int i = 0;
                                while(queue.hasNext())
                                        objects[i++] = queue.next();
                                Arrays.sort(objects); // MergeSort SDK
                                return new ArrayCursor(objects);
                        }
                },
                true, true
        );
        new VisualSink(sorter, "Sorter", true);

Since:
1.1
See Also:
Function, Predicate, Queue, Heap

PredicateSorter

PredicateSorter

public PredicateSorter(Source<? extends I> source,
                       int sourceID,
                       Queue<I> buffer,
                       Predicate<Object> overflows,
                       Function<? super Queue<I>,? extends Iterator<I>> sortFunction)
Creates a new PredicateSorter as an internal component of a query graph.
The subscription to the specified source is fulfilled immediately.

Parameters:
source - This pipe gets subscribed to the specified source.
sourceID - This pipe uses the given ID for subscription.
buffer - The queue buffering the incoming elements.
overflows - Binary predicate that determines, when the buffer is to be sorted and flushed.
sortFunction - Unary function used for sorting. f: Queue --> Iterator.

PredicateSorter

public PredicateSorter(Source<? extends I> source,
                       int sourceID,
                       Heap<I> heap,
                       Predicate<Object> overflows)
Creates a new PredicateSorter as an internal component of a query graph.
The subscription to the specified source is fulfilled immediately. The specified heap is used as buffer, which organizes the incoming elments.

Parameters:
source - This pipe gets subscribed to the specified source.
ID - This pipe uses the given ID for subscription.
heap - The heap buffering and organizing the incoming elements.
overflows - Binary predicate that determines, when the buffer is to be flushed.

processObject

public void processObject(I o,
                          int sourceID)
                   throws IllegalArgumentException
Updates the input rate. If the predicate overflows is fulfilled, the sort-function is applied to the buffer and each element of the resulting iterator is transferred to all of this pipe's subscribed sinks. After that the buffer is cleared and the given element is inserted. Otherwise the element is inserted directly.

Specified by:
processObject in class AbstractPipe<I,I>
Parameters:
o - The element streaming in.
ID - The ID this pipe specified during its subscription by an underlying source.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - If the given element or ID is incorrect.

close

public void close()
Calls super.close() and closes the queue used for buffering.

Specified by:
close in interface Source<I>
Overrides:
close in class AbstractPipe<I,I>

done

public void done(int sourceID)
Applies the sort-function to the buffer and transfers all elements of the resulting iterator to the subscribed sinks of this pipe. After that this method calls super.done(ID), which closes the buffer and forwards the done call.

Specified by:
done in interface Sink<I>
Overrides:
done in class AbstractPipe<I,I>
Parameters:
ID - The ID this pipe specified during its subscription by an underlying source.
